title: The Block 2019: When Mitch and Mark knew they had nailed it
text:
Mitch and Mark’s decision to turn the upstairs main bedroom space into a lavish living and entertaining area was always going to be a risk — and a controversial move.

But in last night’s episode, when real estate agents brought through potential buyers who gave each of the five properties a mark out of 10, it was the boys who came out on top.

Their builder Jason Charles said winning the buyers’ vote and getting positive feedback on the night was “100 per cent” the moment they knew they’d made the right decision.

“Obviously, they were very excited,” the Hipages tradie, of Charles Bro Building Contractors, said.

“That’s when I think they really started flourishing going forward, knowing they were on the right track for the buyers, so knowing that all the other houses were going to be the same, it sort of separated themselves from everybody else; it was a really good move.

“They were sort of waiting to see somebody else’s view on it because obviously they had the view from the judges every week, but they hadn’t really had any outside people come in to come through, so that was the first time that people had done that, so they were pretty excited to see they were on the right track and people really loved the property.”

One potential buyer was shown expressing the fact they could turn the upstairs entertaining room, which features a bar and working fireplace, into a bedroom if they wanted to anyway.

Another inspecting the next-door property was not turned off by potentially having people entertaining on the other side of that pad’s bedroom wall, saying people enjoying themselves having drinks and entertaining was part of the St Kilda lifestyle and wasn’t a turn off.

Mitch and Mark’s use of a potential main bedroom as a living space also converted their property from four to three bedrooms.
